thread.title: Boys’ cross country team gets second at North Linn
thread.title_full: Boys’ cross country team gets second at North Linn

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Boys’ cross country team gets second at North Linn
text:
Boys’ cross country team gets second at North Linn Oct 13, 2015 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
NORTH LINN — The Mt. Pleasant cross country team ran in North Linn this weekend, and the Panther boys once again made a move to improve their ranking. The currently seventh-ranked Panthers finished second out of 20 teams, falling to Monticello (69-91), but finishing ahead of three ranked teams, including current 3A No. 5 Marion (92-154). The girls had some success of their own, finishing 16th. 
On the boys’ side, Logan Murray won his sixth meet of the year, finishing in 16:08 to lead the Panthers. Adam Bodenham was 10th, in 17:08 and Kyle Vanderham had one of his best races, finishing just nine seconds behind Bodenham with a 17th place 17:17. 
Other finishers for the MP boys were Cody Mertens (26th, 17:35); Ryan Hutchinson (37th, 17:48); Jonathan Ita (45th, 17:59) and Dalton Krum (54th, 18:06). Head coach Mitch Anderson called the performance the “best team race of the season.” 
On the girls’ side, the top three runners finished with personal records. Taylor Murray was back in action and finished 40th, with a 21:10. Delaney McDowell ran in 21:47 for 63rd place and Kelsey Notestein was 91st, in 23:06. 
Catherine Prough and Megan Shumaker crossed the finish line at 25:49. Prough edged Shumaker out for 109th, while Shumaker finished 110th. Emma Smith ran a 115th place 26:58, and Megan Hoenig was 116th, in 27:18. Two junior varsity runners, Laurie Amos (104th, 27:19) and Emily Larson (114th, 28:26) also ran personal bests. 
The teams will now turn their attention to the conference meet in Washington, on Oct. 15. State qualifying will take place in Fairfield one week later (Oct. 22), with both meets starting at 4 p.m.
